news_header: Explorer Cobre reports promising assay results from its Ngami copper project in Botswana, indicating high-grade discovery potential.
news_original_title: Cobre Reports Ngami Copper Project Assay Results, Further Drilling Planned
news_text: Explorer Cobre (ASX:CBE) announced assay results from its Ngami copper project in Botswana, revealing potential for high-grade discoveries along known mineralisation. The results include significant copper and silver grades from drill holes targeting the Cosmos area. CEO Adam Woolridge highlighted the potential for a high-grade deposit northeast of the Comet area and noted that the mineralisation extends over a 4 km strike length. The project, located in the Kalahari Copper Belt, has an estimated scale of 103 to 166 million tonnes of copper at 0.38 to 0.46 percent. Infill drilling is ongoing to upgrade the Comet target to JORC standards.
